intro: Hieracium nigrisetulum, commonly known as the black-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist grasslands and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and often have a dark green color, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium nigrisetulum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
